explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

self_reactive_substances.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive or self-reactive properties present in the molecule.

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures, which in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: The chemical structure of the substance does not contain metals or metaloids(B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At).

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Organic compounds containing oxygen (but not chlorine and fluorine) chemically bonded only to carbon (but not to other elements).

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: SPECIES: Rat ENDPOINT: LD50 VALUE: 2000 mg/kg REFERENCE SOURCE: PATTY (5th, 2001)

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on not having observed fatal cases in 2000mg/kg in a rat (EU-RAR (2002)), it was set as the outside of Category.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: As aerosol, it is rat LC50 >3.87mg/L (EU-RAR (2002)). Since Category could not be specificked, it presupposed it cannot classify.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Erythema and slight edemas were observed in the skin irritation test on rabbits based on the OECD guideline 404. But all were described to have disappeared within 72 hours after patch removal (EU-RAR (2002)). Therefore it was classified as Category 3.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Although dropsy and redness of a conjunctiva, iritis, and keratitis were observed in the eye stimulativeness examination of the rabbit based on the OECD guideline 404, all were disappear within seven days after apply (EU-RAR (2002)). So it was set to Category 2B.

respiratory_skin_sensitizer.classification: Respiratory sensitization: Classification not possible; Skin sensitization: Classification not possible
respiratory_skin_sensitizer.rationale: Skin sensitization test using guinea pigs assesses this as "a weak sensitizer" (EU-RAR (2002) and there is a report that the frequency of atopic dermatitis became high among children who are exposed to a mixture including this product in humans (EU-RAR (2002)). However, it appends a note that adequacy is lacking in the former (guinea pigs) because of insufficient information, and it describes that it is difficult to evaluate whether this product is a cause beause the exposing mixture includes 20 or more substances in the latter (humans). Therefore, we classified this as "uncategorizable" because of insufficient data.

germ_cell_mutagenicity.hazard_statement: Suspected of causing genetic defects (state route of exposure if it is conclusively proven that no other routes of exposure cause the hazard)
germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: All the results of the micronucleus tests in rats and mice, which were done as in vivo mutagenicity tests using somatic cells, are negative (DFGOT vol.10(1998)). But induction was observed in the gene mutation test using transgenic mice (EU-RAR (2002)). So the substance was classified as Category 2 by the guidelines. There are also positive results from some in vivo DNA synthesis tests or DNA adduct tests and host mediated assays (DFGOT vol.10 (1998)).

carcinogenicity.hazard_statement: Suspected of causing cancer (state route of exposure if it is conclusively proven that no other routes of exposure cause the hazard)
carcinogenicity.rationale: It is classified into 2B in IARC and into A3 in ACGIH at almost same period. A GHS classifications is set as Category 2 even if either was adopted.

toxic_to_reproduction.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause damage to organs (central nervous system, blood system)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: After more than 690mg/kg of the substance was orally administered to rats, vascular stasis and increase in methaemoglobin level as well as central symptoms, such as curling up, staggering, decrease in locomotor activity, vertigo (DFGOT vol.10 (1998), EU-RAR (2002)), cyanosis (EU-RAR (2002)) were observed. Central symptoms were slightly observed after the exposure to 3.87mg/L by inhalation (DFGOT vol.10 (1998)). The substance was classified as Category 2 (central nervous system, blood) based on these results.

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause damage to organs (blood) through prolonged or repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Due to the description that in the four-week repeated oral administration study using rat, the hemalytic anemia was occurred in more than 80 mg/kg dose (EU-RAR (2002), DFGOT vol.10 (1998)), it was classified into Category 2 (blood). In addition, in human, although anemia did not appear in the workers who were exposed for six months in ortho anisidine (0.4 ml/m3) day for 3.5 hours per day, the increase of sulfhemoglobin and methemoglobin are observed (DFGOT vol.10(1998)).

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 2 from 48-hour EC50=6800microg/L of Crustacea (Daphnia magna), and others (MOE Risk Assessment No.2, 2003).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since rapidly degrading (the decomposition of TOC: 83% (Existing Chemicals Safety Check Data)), and supposed less bio-accumulative (log Kow=1.18 (PHYSPROP Database, 2005)).
